I don't know if this is exactly what you are looking for, but the city of Provo, UT has located their Economic Development Office, and Redevelopment Agency's Office in commercial space office space in their downtown, while other departments remain at city hall.   If you would like more information on the history you can contact the Redevelopment Agency at 801-852-6160, or the Deputy Mayor for Economic Development at 801-852-6166.

answers.text:
Tracy, the City of Charlottesville owns a space called City Space.  It's underneath a municipal parking garage and above serveral retail spaces that the City also owns and leases out to businesses.  The cool thing about this space is that it serves as an extended meeting space for City Hall, a public meeting space that includes a kitchen, small conference room, larger meeting room and a gallery space (anyone can use the space via a reservation) and since it's opened, non profits who also occupy the space have managed it for us.  Here's the website - management just transfered over as of today to a new non profit - Piedmont Council for the Arts.  http://charlottesvillearts.org/cityspace/ 
Good luck with your research!

author: Tracy Miller
text:
A Florida city is looking at the possibility of placing city hall as part of downtown commercial space. The property may become shared space with a convention center and/or hotel or a retail district.  We are looking for examples where city hall and/or government buildings have been co-located with commercial property.  Please respond here or directly to tmiller@transformgov.org.  
Best Regards,  
Tracy Miller  
Alliance for Innovation  
tmiller@transformgov.org
title: Creative City Hall Complex Examples
